name: insertItem(list, index, item)
content: In real life you sometimes need to add items at various positions in a list, and make the list larger. *insertItem(list, index, item)* makes the "list" one larger and inserts the "item" at the specified *index* position (moving other items to the right). The index must be a valid index position in the list or you may get unexpected results.

examples.name: Example: Favorite Foods
Example: Fibonacci
examples.description: Generate the first 10 numbers in the fibonacci sequence.

palette_params.name: list
palette_params.description: The variable name of the list (array) you want to insert the item into.

palette_params.name: index
palette_params.description: The index position you want to insert the item at.

palette_params.name: item
palette_params.description: The number or string item to be inserted into the list.

short_description: Inserts the item into the array at the specified index position.
tips:
- List(array) manipulation functions include: [appendItem(list, item)](/docs/applab/appendItem), [insertItem(list, index, item)](/docs/applab/insertItem) and [removeItem(list, index)](/docs/applab/removeItem).
- Multiple calls to *insertItem()* can be slow because to expand the list, Javascript needs to create a new list one item larger and then copy all the items over before instering the new item at the end. If possible it is better to create the list intially large enough for all the possible items and *list[index]* to add new items at specific positions.
